title.en: A Prayer to Khandro Yeshé Tsogyal

text.en: Samantabhadrī, the dharmadhātu mother of all buddhas,
text.en-trans: gyal kün kyé yum chöying kunzang mo

text.en: Supremely kind, sole mother who protects the Tibetan people,
text.en-trans: bö bang kyobpé ma chik drinmo ché

text.en: Chief ḍākinī of great bliss, you bestow the supreme siddhi,
text.en-trans: ngödrub chok tsol dechen khandrö tso

text.en: Yeshé Tsogyal, to you I pray.
text.en-trans: yeshe tsogyal zhab la solwa deb

text.en: Grant your blessing so that all outer, inner, and secret obstacles may be pacified.
text.en-trans: chi nang sangwé barché zhiwa dang

text.en: Grant your blessing so that the gurus may live long.
Grant your blessing so that this era’s disease, famine and warfare may be pacified.
text.en-trans: né muk tsön kal zhiwar jingyi lob

text.en: Grant your blessing so that evil sorcery and spells may be overcome.
Grant your blessing so that my lifespan, glory and wisdom may increase.
text.en-trans: tsé pal sherab gyepar jingyi lob

text.en: Grant your blessing so that all my wishes may be spontaneously fulfilled.
text.en-trans: sampa lhün gyi drubpar jingyi lob
